medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. ___ reports the onset of mild pain within his right lower quadrant and right groin beginning yesterday, with an increase in pain following heavy snow shoveling the day prior. The pain worsened overnight, becoming severe by this morning, accompanied by nausea and lightheadedness. Pain intensity peaked at its worst and was aggravated by movements and after urination, though there was no clear dysuria, hematuria, or burning with urination. He experienced intermittent acute pain throughout the day, lasting several minutes.
